title: Europe may be too late to stop second wave as cases 'almost back' to March levels
description: Coronavirus cases in Europe are "almost back" to the levels seen in March when infection rates first peaked, scientists have warned as concerns grow over a potential second wave.

title: Neymar reportedly one of six PSG players to test positive for Covid-19
description: Brazilian international Neymar is one of three Paris Saint-Germain players to have tested positive for Covid-19, according to multiple reports.

title: Muguruza delivers epic racket smash
description: Garbine Muguruza lost her racket and her US Open match Thursday against a tricky foe who returned to the circuit this week after becoming a mom.

title: Latinos make up 60 percent of Covid-19 cases in California
description: Latinos make up about 60 percent of coronavirus cases in California, according to the state's department of public health, even though they constitute less than 40 percent of the state's population. CNN's Stephanie Elam explains why.

title: Journalist: Surveillance of poisoned Putin critic was constant
description: Russian security services closely monitored Alexey Navalny's every step -- that's according to one former pro-Kremlin journalist who tells CNN he used secretly filmed footage to make documentaries on Russia's leading opposition figure. CNN's Matthew Chance reports how the security services watched Navalny in hotel rooms, restaurants and on holiday.

title: Miley Cyrus opens up about marriage to Liam Hemsworth
description: Miley Cyrus' breakup with Liam Hemsworth didn't happen the way you might believe.

title: A house fire killed a firefighter's family while he was away battling a blaze
description: A firefighter battling a wildfire in Washington state near the Canadian border lost his wife and three children in an early-morning blaze that destroyed their new home.

title: Markets are flashing a big warning sign
description:
• Stocks have worst day in three months
• Asian markets follow Wall Street lower as tech sell-off continues

title: Messi's father confirms he's exploring option of remaining at Barcelona
description: Lionel Messi's father and agent has confirmed that he's exploring the option of the Barcelona talisman staying at the club for one more year.

title: Taco Bell is eliminating five more menu items
description: Taco Bell is eliminating five more menu items, marking the second time in less than three months that it overhauled its selection.

title: Facebook will let US politicians lie in ads through Election Day
description: In an attempt to combat efforts to undermine the US presidential election in November, Facebook on Thursday took several steps it says will address concerns about election interference on its platform.

title: Top doctor advises people to wear masks while having sex
description: Canada's chief public health officer is advising people to wear masks during sex and not to kiss anyone new.

title: Tatooine-like exoplanet may be in orbit
description: When Luke Skywalker emerges from his home at dusk on the planet Tatooine in "Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope," he watches twin suns setting in the sky. The two suns are misaligned, with one lower in the sky than the other.

title: Thai King reinstates his royal consort after declaring her 'untainted'
description: King Maha Vajiralongkorn of Thailand is welcoming his consort back into the royal household, a surprise move that comes as the country is in the throes of an unprecedented protest movement calling for reforms to both government and the monarchy.

title: Trump accidentally revealed something important in tweet
description:
• Analysis: There's officially no Trump polling bounce out of the conventions
• Trump pressures the FDA ahead of elections

title: 'Steep rise' in racism and homophobia in UK soccer
description: There has been a "steep rise" in the levels of discrimination around English football, according to anti-racism group Kick It Out.

title: Miley Cyrus opens up about Liam Hemsworth divorce
description: Singer Miley Cyrus talked about sobriety and her divorce from Liam Hemsworth during an interview on "The Joe Rogan Experience" podcast.

title: Thai King reinstates his royal consort
description: King Maha Vajiralongkorn is welcoming his consort back into the royal household, almost a year after she was accused of trying to usurp power and prestige from the queen.

title: Endangered gorillas experience unprecedented baby boom
description: Uganda's Bwindi Impenetrable National Park is experiencing an unprecedented baby boom in its mountain gorilla population after seven infants were born so far this year, compared to two in the whole of 2019, according to officials.

title: What Chadwick Boseman taught us about humanity -- and how we can honor his legacy
description: Chadwick Boseman was more than just a movie star.

title: Dolly Parton gives marriage advice to country star
description: Dolly Parton shares some marriage advice with fellow country singer Gabby Barrett during an interview for Amazon Music.

title: 'No Time To Die' trailer is a wild ride around the world
description: The trailer for "No Time To Die" has dropped -- and the franchise looks better than ever.

title: Inside Europe's busiest (and cutest) wildlife hospital
description: Sprained paw? Broken wing? Tiggywinkles will get you back to roaring health. With over 10,000 animals coming through the door each year, Tiggywinkles wildlife hospital is the busiest (and cutest) in all of Europe. Named after the beloved Beatrix Potter children's book character, the hospital employs around-the-clock doctors and nurses who treat injured and sick wild animals. At Tiggywinkles, no creature is too big or too small—each is given loving care until they are strong enough to be released back into the wild.

title: The pandemic may have just killed overtourism
description: Let's journey back to a different time. One that feels far away. Early January 2020.

title: Rory McIlroy and wife Erica Stoll welcome baby girl
description: Rory McIlroy and wife Erica Stoll welcomed a baby girl into the world on Monday.

title: Lili Reinhart 'feels like a prisoner' returning to 'Riverdale' set
description: Lili Reinhart is grateful for her gig on "Riverdale," but not thrilled about going back to work.

title: $10M 'dream coin' goes up for sale again
description: A rare 1794 Silver Dollar believed to be one of the first -- if not the first -- to be struck by the US Mint is going up for sale.

title: PGA Tour 'expects to generate over $100m' towards racial and social injustice causes
description: PGA Tour commissioner Jay Monahan says that he expects the Tour to raise over $100 million towards racial and social injustice causes over the next 10 years.

title: Vast size of prehistoric megalodon shark revealed for the first time
description: The true size of a gigantic prehistoric megalodon shark that ruled the oceans millions of years ago has been revealed for the first time -- and it had teeth as big as hands, and a fin as tall as a human adult.

title: Cate Blanchett says she's an 'actor not an actress'
description: Cate Blanchett says she has always been "an actor."

title: A drop in travel helps the planet. But there's a catch
description: With global travel largely on pause during the Covid-19 pandemic, some cities and companies see an opportunity to rethink tourism with the planet's health in mind.

title: Police officer poisoned by Novichok in UK issues cryptic tweet on Navalny
description: • Analysis: Good luck getting answers out of Russia on latest high-profile poisoning

title: Why new hotels are opening amid the pandemic
description: To say that Covid-19 has hurt the hotel industry, along with travel as a whole, is something of an understatement.

title: Pro ski champion lives double life as social media star
description: Balancing a career in professional sport with being a social media sensation is a tightrope to walk.

title: Search underway for missing ship with 43 sailors and 5,800 cows aboard
description: A lone sailor has been rescued from the dark waters of the Pacific Ocean after a cargo ship with 43 people aboard went missing during Typhoon Maysak, according to the Japan Coast Guard.

title: The '60-day rule' for elections Barr may be willing to bend for Trump
description: If there was any question before about whether William Barr could be willing to use his power as attorney general to tilt the scales in the upcoming presidential election, there shouldn't be anymore.  Barr appeared to confirm as much in his interview with Wolf Blitzer on CNN Wednesday: that he would be willing to breach longstanding Justice Department norms -- that is, the unwritten "60-day rule" -- to advantage the re-election campaign of President Donald Trump.

title: David Blaine flies to almost 25,000 feet by holding on to helium balloons
description: David Blaine just managed to do what so many can only dream of -- flying up into the air using a bunch of balloons.

title: MacKenzie Scott has become the world's richest woman
description: MacKenzie Scott — philanthropist, author and ex-wife of Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos — is now the wealthiest woman in the world.

title: Tom Seaver, Hall of Fame pitcher, dies at 75
description: Hall of Fame pitcher Tom Seaver, a three-time Cy Young Award winner and 12-time all-star, has died at the age of 75, the National Baseball Hall of Fame, citing Seaver's family, and Major League Baseball said Wednesday.

title: The Rock says he's on the mend from coronavirus
description: Dwayne Johnson said he's won a fight against Covid-19, but is warning others that the virus was a formidable foe even for him.

title: Led by 105-year-old survivor, lawsuit seeks reparations in 1921 Tulsa race massacre
description: A 105-year-old survivor of the 1921 race massacre in Tulsa, Oklahoma, is the lead figure in a lawsuit that demands reparations for damage it says has continued since the destruction of the city's Black business district.

title: David Blaine floats 5 miles above the Earth with balloons
description: Fifty-two helium balloons take illusionist David Blaine on a wild ride over the Arizona desert almost 5 miles up in the sky. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports on the epic stunt.

title: From warship movements to declassifying long-secret documents, Washington is letting Beijing know it won't abandon Taipei
Trump appears to encourage North Carolinians to vote twice to test the system
description: President Donald Trump on Wednesday appeared to encourage people in North Carolina to vote twice -- once by mail and once in person -- during the November general election to purportedly double check that their initial vote was counted, which is already receiving push back from state election officials.

title: Cannabis is illegal in Hong Kong. Here's how the owner of a CBD cafe skirted the law
description: On a rare pedestrian-only corner of Hong Kong's Sheung Wan area, hidden deep within a heavily gentrified maze of sleek micro roasters and dusty Chinese antique shops, there's a stylish, unassuming shop with a few tables out on its terrace.

title: Nancy Pelosi just handed Trump a campaign gift
NFL star takes Darwinian view on Covid-19
description: Minnesota Vikings quarterback Kirk Cousins is taking a controversial approach to Covid-19 for a man of his stature.
